thought.text:
Excellent! I'm getting closer to the root cause. The error "The truth value of an array with more than one element is ambiguous" is exactly the kind of issue that could cause problems in the comparison logic.

Let me fix the test and continue:

action.old_str:
# Test the comparison logic from diff.py
    print(f"\nTesting comparison logic:")
    print(f"vlf1 is vlf2: {vlf1 is vlf2}")
    print(f"vlf1 == vlf2: {vlf1 == vlf2}")
action.new_str:
# Test the comparison logic from diff.py
    print(f"\nTesting comparison logic:")
    print(f"vlf1 is vlf2: {vlf1 is vlf2}")
    try:
        eq_result = vlf1 == vlf2
        print(f"vlf1 == vlf2: {eq_result}")
    except Exception as e:
        print(f"vlf1 == vlf2 failed: {e}")
        print("This could be part of the issue!")
